physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Ms. A was grossly dysphoric and had ongoing suicidal ideation. Two psychiatrists felt that Ms. A lacked capacity to consent to a termination of pregnancy on the day of admission.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Over five days of hospitalization, Ms. A engaged with the inpatient milieu, began to integrate viewpoints from other patients, expressed ambivalence about her prior request for termination, and demonstrated understanding of the risks and benefits of the proposed abortion procedure.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A fetal ultrasound examination demonstrated a male fetus with no evidence of congenital malformation. Both psychiatrists felt that Ms. Aâ€™s capacity to consent to an abortion had been restored.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, Ms. A expressed a desire for an abortion, but after treatment, she elected to carry the fetus to term.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: In the postpartum period, Ms. A was noted to be euthymic and had continued her venlafaxine and olanzapine with sustained remission of depressive symptoms.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Ms. A's depressive symptoms improved significantly by the time of her postpartum evaluation.
